back:
replaced elemets are those where the element's content that is replaced by something that is not directly represented in the document content  

img and input elements are replaced elements  

example: <img src='example.png/>

nonreplaced elements are the majority of HTML elements.

Their content is presented by the user agent inside a box genreated by the element itself

example: <span>nonreplaced</span>

block-level elements

  • generate an element box that fills its parent element's content area and cannot have other elements at its sides inline-level elements
  • generate an element box within a line of text and do not break up the fow of that line

block-level cannot be contained in inline-level elements in HTML - violation.

CSS can change or add this behavior:

<p><em>example</em></p>

p {display: inline;}

em {display: block}

<link rel='stylesheet' type='text/css' href='css/html.css' media='all' />

common media attributes:

  • print
  • projection
  • screen
  • all

note: must be placed before other css rules or it won't work at all

<style type='text/css'>

@import url(style.css);

h1 {color: grey}

</style>

/* comment here - mutli-line is ok too */

note: no other comments allowed
